evaluationTypeDescriptions.anc_cond: The Behavioral Anchor evaluation type allows you to select a single response among several vertically, the description of each label must be entered at the time of associating the Behavioral Anchor to the Behavior or response. For more details click here.
evaluationTypeDescriptions.dropdown: The Dropdown evaluation type allows you to select a single answer from a dropdown list of answers. For more details click here.
evaluationTypeDescriptions.likert: The likert evaluation type allows to select a single answer among several answers in a horizontal way, sometimes its label can be associated to a description. For more details click here.
evaluationTypeDescriptions.slider: The Slider evaluation type allows you to select an answer from a range of possible results. The labels and values of this assessment type are generated by the conversion table when associated with a competency. For more details click here.
evaluationTypeDescriptions.star: The Star evaluation type allows you to select a result or answer in the form of a star. The number next to the star indicates the number of stars selected, however, the number of stars may not match your entered value, for example, 2 stars may be associated with 300 Points. For more details click here.

uploadFile.subtitle: Massive upload instructions:

instructions.first: Download the empty excel template. It should come with 3 sheets: goal_groups, collaborators and goals.
instructions.second: In the goal_groups sheet you should see 3 columns: group_goal_name, group_goal_id and category_id. In the group_goal_name column, place the name of the group, example: Group Managers. In the group_goal_id column, enter the id of the group, example: goal_group_gerentes_100_12900 (The id of the groups must be different). In the category_id column enters the category identifier where the goals will go, example: evaluator. If it is self-assessment, enter self-assessment.
instructions.third: In the second sheet called collaborator you should see 2 columns: collaborator_id and group_goal_id. In the collaborator_id column put the id of the collaborator belonging to the group, example: 16978857-6. In the goal_group_id column, enter the id of the group, example: goal_group_gerentes_100_12900. In this way you will assign the collaborators to each group.
instructions.fourth: In the third sheet called goals you will see the same columns from the goals and individual goals template, however, instead of the columns containing the id of the collaborators and their evaluator, you should There should be a column called group_goal_id. In this column, enter the id of the goal group and fill in the appropriate fields.
instructions.secondAuto: In the goal_groups sheet you should see 3 columns: group_goal_name, group_goal_id and category_id. In the group_goal_name column, place the name of the group, for example: Managers Group. In the group_goal_id column, enter the group id, for example: goal_group_managers_100_12900 (The group IDs must be different). In the category_id column, enter the identifier of the category where the goals will go, for example: evaluator. If it is self-evaluation, place auto.

confirmModifyGroup.confirmDescription2:
The changes will be applied en masse to the child goals and goals of the group. Before continuing, you should know the following:

  • The changes made by the Administrator in the values ​​of the fields of the objectives and goals of the group, they will replace the values ​​put by the evaluators in those fields.
  • If there are no changes in the other fields of the objectives and goals of the group , there will be no replacement in the values ​​placed by the evaluator.
  • The changes will only be visible in the child goals and goals when pressing the “Accept” button of this modal.
< /p>

If you agree, write APPLY CHANGES to confirm

general.activeTooltip: During this process, goal setting will be active
general.title: General Setup
general.tooltip: Global settings which allow changes to objective and goal functionality and behavior.
general.stages: Select the stage of the flow where the closing survey will be displayed
general.enabledGoalAssessment: Enable objectives and goals' assessment with competences
general.enabledGoalAssessmentTooltip: It will be possible to manage and evaluate the objectives and goals from the evaluation of competencies. By selecting this optionthe stage of fixation objectives and goals will automatically be deactivated
general.selfAssessmentActive: Enable self-assessment of objectives and goals
general.selfAssessmentActiveTooltip: The objectives and goals from the collaborator's top-down evaluations will be replicated to their self-evaluation. Replication will only work if the goals and objectives of the collaborator's top-down evaluations come from a bulk upload. If the evaluator adds other objectives and goals from the evaluation, they will not be replicated
general.selfAssessmentWeight: Consider the weighting of the self-assessment for the overall result
general.selfAssessmentWeightTooltip: It allows the weighting of the collaborator's self-evaluation to be considered for the calculation of the final average of the collaborator's objectives and goals
general.stagesFeedback: Select the stage of the flow where feedback will be enabled for the downstream evaluator
general.enableReplyTooltip: Enables, for both the objective and the goal, the button " Replicate ", which allows the evaluator to copy an objective or a goal to a collaborator that belongs to his list of evaluated in any evaluation category.
general.enableDistributeWeightTooltip: Enables the "Distribute" button that allows you to distribute, in equal parts, the weights of the goals belonging to the objective.
general.notEvaluableGoals: Allow creating non-evaluable goals by default
general.notEvaluableGoalsTooltip: Each time the evaluator/evaluate adds a goal, it will be automatically assigned as "Not evaluable", this means that the evaluator/evaluate will be able to finish the evaluation without evaluating these goals.
general.showGoalSection: Show section to users who will not have goals and objectives
general.showGoalSectionTooltip: Show the goals and objectives section to all raters, regardless of whether they have goals loaded or not. If set to "No" the section is NOT shown to users who do not have preloaded goals or goals.
general.showSelfGoalSection: Show section to users who will not have goals and objectives in the Self Assessment
general.showSelfGoalSectionTooltip: Show the goals and objectives section to all collaborators in their self-assessment, regardless of whether they have uploaded goals or not. If set to "No", the section is NOT shown to users who will not have preloaded goals or objectives in self-assessment.
general.goalsInFeedback: Enable setting goals and targets in feedback
general.goalsInFeedbackTooltip: Allows down raters to set goals and targets in the feedback stage. Remember to enable the goals in feedback section in the individual report.
general.enableDistributeWeightTooltipNew: Enable the Distribute button, which allows the weighting of goals and objectives to be distributed equally automatically.
general.enableDistributeGoalsWeight: Show button distribute weighting of goals
general.enableDistributeGoalsWeightTooltip: Enable the Distribute button, which allows you to distribute, in equal parts, the weightings of the goals automatically.
general.enableDistributeObjectivesWeight: Show button distribute weighting of objectives
general.enableDistributeObjectivesWeightTooltip: Enable the Distribute button, which allows you to distribute, in equal parts, the weightings of the objectives automatically.
general.allowReturnInFinal: Allow to return to the list in the final stage if there are incomplete items
general.allowReturnInFinalTooltip: If disabled, the evaluator or evaluator will not be able to return to the goal setting list until the missing items in the objectives or targets are completed.

copyConfiguration.confirmDescription:
Before starting the copying, read the following:
  • All types of objectives and goals created in the selected process will be cloned in this process. The fields for the types of goals in both processes will be locked for modification. Please make sure that you have created all the fields in the goal type in the selected process, including its formula.


  • The copying process will be carried out in the import center, please do not make changes to this process or to the selected one as it could cause data loss.


  • After you have started copying the objectives and goals of a source process, you will not be able to select another process. Please check that the selected process

    is correct
  • . All existing objectives and goals of the collaborators in this process will be eliminated.


If you agree, write COPY to confirm and begin copying objectives and goals.

verification.description:
On Verification Stage, participants must check if people assigned to them for the assessment are correct.

You can choose different permissions according to different user roles.
verification.rolesDescription:
User Roles:

Verifier: Verifies that manager's assignation of its direct reports is correct.

Manager: Verifies if employees assigned to them for the assessment are correct.

Employee: Verifies if manager assigned to assess them is correct.

conversionTable.convertionInfo:
When getting the information from the conversion table, the average to be compared is rounded according to the decimals that have been configured in the process, for example if you got 2.438 and you have 1 decimal set, the average to compare will be 2.4. In addition, the following things should be considered:
  • It is recommended to configure the same number of decimal places as those used in the conversion table.
  • It is recommended that the conversion table have 3 decimal places for better accuracy.
  • No more decimals should be configured than in the conversion table, as there may be results that remain unassigned.

confirmationModal.confirmation: Si estás de acuerdo presiona 'Confirmar' para continuar con el cambio de categoría.
confirmationModal.footer: Con respecto a los objetivos y metas del proceso: Se mantendrán, mientras la nueva categoría tenga activa la visualización de objetivos y metas, en caso contrario, se eliminarán.

first.label: a) Cambio de categoría sin resultados existentes en la evaluación: Se cambia de categoría considerando para ello cambio en: Ponderaciones de competencias, conductas, formularios, CV y Metas que tenga la nueva categoría.

bullets.first: Categoría actual tiene las mismas competencias/conductas que la Categoría nueva: Se conservan respuestas y la evaluación pasará a estado 'En progreso'.
bullets.second: Categoría actual tiene diferentes competencias/conductas que categoría nueva: Se eliminarán las respuestas de la categoría actual, pero se mantendrán aquellas que coincidan con la nueva. La evaluación pasará a estado 'En progreso'.

second.label: b) Cambio de categoría con resultados existentes en la evaluación:

confirmationModal.generalText: Al cambiar la categoría de evaluación, la plataforma realizará lo siguiente según el contexto:

secondaryPoints.first: Calibración: Se reseteará su estado a 'No calibrado'.
secondaryPoints.fourth: Coordinación: Se reseteará su estado a 'Por coordinar', pero los comentarios y entrevista realizada se mantendrán.
secondaryPoints.second: Validación: Se reseteará su estado a 'No validado'.
secondaryPoints.third: Feedback: Se reseteará su estado a 'No Realizado' o 'En progreso' dependiendo si se han creado planes de acción.

confirmationModal.secondaryText: Con respecto a los estados de las demás etapas del proceso se realizará lo siguiente:

verification.instructionsHtml:
Rankmi permite que las organizaciones puedan llevar a cabo las evaluaciones del talento de forma rápida, potente y fácil. En esta plataforma podrás:

  1. Autoevaluarte
  2. Evaluar las metas y competencias de tus colaboradores.
  3. Llevar a cabo reuniones de retroalimentación y fijar planes de acción.
  4. Hacer seguimiento a los compromisos asumidos.
  5. Acceder a los resultados de la evaluación de desempeño.

Tu administrador de recursos humanos te ha asignado algunas de estas tareas. Recuerda que puedes contactar a soporte si tienes cualquier duda. Esta herramienta funciona mejor con Firefox o Google Chrome. Si no los tienes instalados, asegúrate de obtenerlos.

Gracias por tu participación!

a1.title: A1 (Access) (Basic)
a1.description: Able to understand and utilize frequent daily expressions. Can introduce him/herself, ask for and receive personal information. Can communicate when the contact speaks slowly and clearly.

a2.title: A2 (Platform) (Basic)
a2.description: Able to understand frequently used phrases and expressions from his/her relevant areas of expertise. Knows how to communicate in order to complete simple daily tasks with simple exchanges of information. Can describe basic aspects of his/her past and surroundings.

b1.title: B1 (Intermediate) (Independent)
b1.description: Able to understand main points of clear, standard texts if they approach known topics. Can navigate the greater part of situations during a trip. Can produce simple texts about known topics and describe experiences, events, as well as brief opinions.

b2.title: B2 (High intermediate) (Independent)
b2.description: Able to understand main ideas in complex texts (concrete, abstract, and technical) when they are within his/her field of specialization. Can communicate with native speakers fluently and effortlessly.  Can produce detailed texts and defend points of view about general topics.

c1.title: C1 (Effective operational proficiency) (Competent)
c1.description: Able to understand a wide variety of texts at a fairly demanding level. Can express him/herself fluently, spontaneously, and effortlessly. Can produce well-structured and detailed texts about certain complex topics, demonstrating the correct use of articulation and cohesion in the text.

c2.title: C2 (Mastery) (Competent)
c2.description: Able to easily understand practically everything he/she hears or reads. Knows how to reconstruct information and arguments from diverse sources, and present them coherently and summarized. Able to express him/herself with great fluency and precision which allows him/her to differenciate small nuances even in complex situations.

modules.distributionCurveDescription: Enable a bar graph with the results of an average that you select. You can add to the bar graph a configurable curve of expected results for this average.
modules.resultDisplay: Allow to view the original result
modules.resultDisplayDescription: After calibrating, the calibrator will be able to see the original result below each calibrated average.
modules.sendEmailWhenCalibrate: Send mail to evaluators after calibrating
modules.sendEmailWhenCalibrateDescription: An email will be sent to all downstream calibrators indicating that their calibration process has been completed.
modules.attributesToCalibrate: Attributes to calibrate from the result
modules.attributesToCalibrateDescription: These are the attributes the calibrator will be able to see and calibrate
modules.resultsToCalibrateDescription: These are the results the calibrator will be able to see and calibrate
modules.evaluationRequired: Require all assessments completed and with result to calibrate
modules.evaluationRequiredDescription: It will only be possible to calibrate if all the evaluations of the evaluated have been completed and contain results. It will also be required to have the Validation completed if it is active
modules.matrixDescription: Enable and configure here the matrix that you want to display in the calibration: General Average Matrix, Default Domain Matrix or a custom one.
modules.quickCalibrationDescription: The calibrator will be able to calibrate the general averages from the “Calibrate” button without going to the individual calibration panel.
modules.enableEvaluatorAsCalibrator: Calibrator can calibrate your descending evaluates
modules.enableEvaluatorAsCalibratorDescription: If the calibrator has in its list of people to calibrate collaborators that it also evaluates downwards, it will be able to calibrate them.
modules.enableGroupReport: Allow download report of the group to be calibrated
modules.enableGroupReportDescription: A button will be enabled that allows downloading an excel report of the group that is being calibrated
modules.historySection: Enable calibration history section of the collaborator
modules.historySectionDescription: The calibrator will be able to access changes history of the collaborator.
modules.individualReportSection: Enable individual report section of the collaborator
modules.individualReportSectionDescription: The calibrator will be able to access the individual report of the collaborator from the individual calibration panel. The display of the report sections depends on the configuration of the individual report.
modules.personalInformationSectionDescription: Enables a section in the individual calibration panel that allows the calibrator to display basic information of the collaborator, such as: Position, email, area and optional.
modules.notesSectionDescription:
The calibrator will be able to enter notes to the individual report of the collaborator from the individual calibration panel.
NOTE:  You must enable private notes for the calibrator from the individual report settings.
modules.successionTreeSectionDescription: The calibrator will be able to add/view projected charges and charges incurred by the collaborator
modules.actionPlansSectionDescription: The calibrator will be able to create action plans directly from the individual calibration panel and can be managed from there. The display and configuration rules of the Action Plans can be managed from the configuration that the process has for it.
modules.calibrationRequiredToFeedbackDescription: Select when the evaluator will be able to access feedback of the evaluated who is calibrated.
modules.mandatoryCommentDescription: When a calibrator modifies an average, is obligated to leave a comment in order to be able to save the change
modules.justificationsEnabled: Allow viewing the answer to the questions of justifications forms associated with a domain.
modules.justificationsEnabledDescription: The calibrator will be able to view the answers to the questions of justifications forms made in the evaluation. Justifications forms are those whose associated tag begins with 'justify_'
modules.formsSection: Enable custom form for the calibrator
modules.formsSectionDescription: The calibrator can answer customized questions on the employee's individual calibration panel.
modules.enableCalibrationMeetings: Enable appointment management for the calibration committee
modules.enableCalibrationMeetingsDescription: Appointment management will be enabled for the calibration committee from the monitoring of calibrations
modules.enableCalibrateOnAccessResults: Allow you to calibrate in the “Access to Results” state
modules.enableCalibrateOnAccessResultsDescriptio: Calibrators will be able to continue calibrating in the process when their status is “Access to Results”
modules.allowAcceptWithoutResults: Allow the calibrator to accept with no results
modules.allowAcceptWithoutResultsDescription: The evaluator will not be required to have all the results in order to be accepted by the calibrator
modules.allowModifyEvaluations: Allow the calibrator to modify evaluations
modules.allowModifyEvaluationsDescription: The calibrator will be able to access the evaluations carried out by the collaborator's evaluators and directly modify the answers

modal.dragAndDropText: Click here or drag your file
modal.checkRecalculate: Recalculate goals and objectives results on file upload
modal.info1: When uploading the file and selecting the 'Recalculate' option will recalculate the goals and objectives results.
modal.info2: Users' final averages will not be recalculated. If you need to recalculate the user's final results, you must perform the reconsolidation of the results after loading the results of goals and/or objectives.

a1.title: A1 (Acceso) (Básico)
a1.description: Capaz de comprender y utilizar expresiones cotidianas de uso frecuente. Puede presentarse, pedir y dar información personal. Puede relacionarse siempre que su interlocutor hable despacio y con claridad.

a2.title: A2 (Plataforma) (Básico)
a2.description: Capaz de comprender frases y expresiones de uso frecuente de áreas de experiencia que le son relevantes. Sabe comunicarse a la hora de llevar a cabo tareas simples y cotidianas con intercambios sencillos de información. Sabe describir en basicamente aspectos de su pasado y entorno.

b1.title: B1 (Intermedio) (Independiente)
b1.description: Capaz de comprender los puntos principales de textos claros y en lengua estándar si tratan sobre cosas conocidas. Sabe desenvolverse en la mayor parte de las situaciones durante un viaje. Puede producir textos sencillos sobre temas que conoce y describir experiencias, acontecimientos, así como justificar brevemente sus opiniones.

b2.title: B2 (Intermedio alto) (Independiente)
b2.description: Capaz de entender ideas principales de textos complejos (concretos, abstractos y técnicos) siempre que estén dentro de su campo de especialización. Puede relacionarse con hablantes nativos fluidamente y sin esfuerzo. Puede producir textos detallados y defender puntos de vista sobre temas generales.

c1.title: C1 (Dominio operativo eficaz) (Competente)
c1.description: Capaz de comprender una amplia variedad de textos con cierto nivel de exigencia. Sabe expresarse de forma fluida y espontánea sin esfuerzo. Puede producir textos bien estructurados y detallados sobre temas de cierta complejidad, mostrando un uso correcto de la articulación y cohesión del texto.

c2.title: C2 (Maestría) (Competente)
c2.description: Capaz de comprender con facilidad prácticamente todo lo que oye o lee. Sabe reconstruir la información y argumentos de diversas fuentes, y presentarlos coherentemente y resumida. Puede expresarse con gran fluidez y precisión que le permite diferenciar pequeños matices de significado incluso en situaciones complejas.

xlsxHeaders.evaluation_type:
For Performance: anc cond, likert, slider or dropdown. Anc Cond is used for evaluation with descriptive behaviors.
Descriptive behaviors are defined within the competencies excel
xlsxHeaders.name: format: enterprise_processid_type
xlsxHeaders.value_1:
The value entered only applies to performance, it allows calculating the results of competitions.
It is a critical data, in the sense that it directly impacts the results

xlsxHeaders.description:
The description of the competencegroups with evaluation with behavioral anchors is seen inside a toolip.
The description of the competencegroups with liker or slider is seen below the name
xlsxHeaders.domain_default:
A default domain must be selected.
Note: The goals will always be associated with the domain by default.
xlsxHeaders.dominio: ID of the associated domain. The questions in the form must not have an associated domain.
xlsxHeaders.evaluation_type:
evaluationtype code
For the "competencegroup" and "competence", load the code of the loaded evaluation type
In form: these evaluation_types already exist on the platform, they should not be previously uploaded
- dropdowns: evaluation_type = "form_dropdown"
- likert: evaluation_type = "form_likert"
- open texts: evaluation_type = "form_text"
- inputs : evaluation_type = "form_input"
- radio button with multiple selection: evaluation_type = "form_select_multiple"
- radio button with simple selection: evaluation_type = "form_select_simple"
xlsxHeaders.group_code:
Unique code with process id. Behaviors within a competencegroup must have the same groupcode.
Competencies are sorted alphabetically by group_code.
To order the skills, it is recommended to leave a number before the code Ex: 01_domibusiness_1377
Behaviors are arranged in load order
xlsxHeaders.identifier:
The domain must have an identifier WITHOUT TILDE, WITHOUT CAPITAL LETTERS, WITHOUT A HYPHEN OR SPACES and that bears the ID of the process.
Can have an underscore
Uploading a domain is required.
Leave an x ​​in the "domain_default" column
xlsxHeaders.item_type:
Domain: uploading a domain is required
Competencegroup: competencies (=grouping of behaviors). The identifier of a competencegroup must be equal to 1
Competence = behavior that is evaluated
form: form
xlsxHeaders.lvl_1:
levels.
With evaluationtype behavioral anchors: the answer options should appear
With evaluation type likert or slider: leave the associated label in the evaluation type
xlsxHeaders.name:
Domain name, competencies, conduct.
There should be NO duplicates
xlsxHeaders.non_editable: Leave an x in case results that cannot be edited are reloaded.
xlsxHeaders.tags:
The "tags" is mandatory. It allows to separate the evaluation in several tabs.
NOTE:
- In the case of several domains, each domain must have a different tag.
- If there is a form, the form can NOT be within the same tag as a domain, otherwise "the process dies"
Obligatory field

xlsxHeaders.administrador: Administrator profile can see the whole process (the one you have)
xlsxHeaders.area: Area to which you want to give access
xlsxHeaders.area_predeterminada: In the case of a collaborator with access to several areas, indicate with "x" which is the area that should be seen by default when entering
xlsxHeaders.incluir_areas_hijas: You can access areas lower than those specified in column B (Ex: Administration and finance - Acquisitions - accounting - comptroller, etc.)
xlsxHeaders.monitoreo: Access to monitoring, review who has completed the evaluation (people in the area)
xlsxHeaders.puede_administrar: Admin access but limited to column B area
xlsxHeaders.puede_ver_planes_de_accion: You can see the action plans that people in the area have created
xlsxHeaders.resultados: You can access the results of the area specified in column B (Ex: Administration and finance)
xlsxHeaders.area_code: The code of the area that it is being created. It must be unique and generated by you.

xlsxHeaders.comment: Comment (in text format, no character limit)
xlsxHeaders.competence: Code of conduct "competence". See the download excel of assignment of competences to obtain this code
xlsxHeaders.evaluator: evaluator identifier (If it is self-appraisal, it must be the same as the identifier)

xlsxHeaders.category_identifier: Evaluation category usage code. REQUIRED FIELD
xlsxHeaders.competence_code: Code of the competencegroup in excel of competences REQUIRED FIELD
xlsxHeaders.description: Description of the suggested action plan. REQUIRED FIELD
xlsxHeaders.family: fcompetences in people excel REQUIRED FIELD
xlsxHeaders.title: Suggested action plan title REQUIRED FIELD

xlsxHeaders.autoevaluation:
f if evaluation
t if self-evaluation.
xlsxHeaders.evaluator:
identifier of the evaluator.
The header must always be called 'evaluator'.
It has nothing to do with the category code.
If self-evaluation, leave empty

xlsxHeaders.area:
Area to which the person belongs. It must be identical to the one loaded in the Hierarchy section
Obligatory field
xlsxHeaders.autoevaluacion: Fill in with an x if the person has to self-assess. Otherwise, leave empty
xlsxHeaders.autofixation_goals: To load this it is necessary that it be together with self-assessment weighting and self-assessment
xlsxHeaders.birthdate:
Date of birth (dd/mm/yy)
The date must be in the format dd/mm/yyyy
xlsxHeaders.calibration_group: Calibration group, form of calibration grouping together with the calibrator, only for processes with calibration.
xlsxHeaders.calibrator:
Calibrator identifier.
A calibrator is assigned to the person, for this the configuration of calibration by people and not by area must be activated.
xlsxHeaders.email:
User Email
In the event that the person does not have an email, put the rut@enterprise.com
Required field, without capital letters, without spaces and there can be no duplicates
xlsxHeaders.exclude_search: If it is marked with x it will not appear in the list of participants
xlsxHeaders.gender:
Gender of the person (f/m)
Complete with an "f" or "m"
xlsxHeaders.identifier:
User identifier
Ideally the rut or corporate number.
It has to be unique. If the person has already participated in other processes, they must have the same identifier of that process. It is recommended that it be a code or email, without accents, spaces or capital letters
Required field
xlsxHeaders.joiningdate: The date must be in the format dd/mm/yyyy
xlsxHeaders.password:
Password
Upon activating their account, the user will be prompted to set their new password. If it comes blank, it does not overwrite or generate a new password
xlsxHeaders.ponderation_autoevaluation:
Weighting of the self-assessment in the general average (without unit).
If it does not apply, leave blank, if it is uploaded blank, the weighting is eliminated
xlsxHeaders.rut:
User's RUT
The k has to be lowercase
Required field
xlsxHeaders.subdomain:
Used to assign a different home screen than the default of the client. For example subsidiaries.
Allows them to see their own logos, and that they can enter through the respective subdomain
xlsxHeaders.username:
Username with which the user will access the platform
Ideally the email or the rut if the person does not have an email
Obligatory field
xlsxHeaders.validator:
Validator.
It is assigned to the evaluators, not to the collaborators!
It can only be one per evaluator, it must be included in the list of people.
It usually coincides with the evaluator of the evaluator.
xlsxHeaders.not_belong_process:
By marking with an x, the person will not be displayed in the evaluation list.
It will be displayed within the verification
xlsxHeaders.area_code:
The code of the area that the participant will be assigned to. It must be identical to the one loaded in the Hierarchy section
Obligatory field
xlsxHeaders.identifier_text:
User identifier in master
Required field
xlsxHeaders.area_code_label: The code of the area to which the participant will be assigned. It must be identical to the one loaded in the Hierarchy section. If empty, the user will be assigned to the default 'No Area' area (RKM_DEFAULT)
xlsxHeaders.convertion_label:
Individual conversion formula.
It allows a person to have a special calculation of the general average, different from the one established in the process.
It must be written in the same way as in the calculation of results.
Ex: competences*0.5+goals*0.2*autoevaluation*0.3 (the formula must have points)
xlsxHeaders.evaluator_1_label:
Identifier of the direct manager.
It must exist as an evaluation category.
There cannot be more than one evaluator in the manager_id category.
 If this category does not exist, delete this column.
xlsxHeaders.fcompetences_label:
User skill family.
If a new skill is uploaded, a new job family will be created in the system.
IT SHOULD NOT HAVE AN UNDERSCORE
Mandatory field in case of competence evaluation to allow the assignment of competencies by family of care.
xlsxHeaders.optional_report_link_label: It allows a link to a downloadable file to be assigned within the evaluation list, under the name of the person, under the name of the person.
xlsxHeaders.ponderation_autoevaluation_label:
Weighting the self-assessment in the overall average (without unit).
If it does not apply, leave blank, if it is raised blank, the weighting is removed.
xlsxHeaders.ponderation_evaluator_label:
Weighting the evaluation of the direct manager in the calculation of the overall average.
If it does not apply, leave blank, if it is raised blank, the previously loaded weight is deleted.
If this category does not exist, delete this column.
xlsxHeaders.second_validator_label:
Matrix validator identifier.
It is assigned to the evaluated collaborators.
xlsxHeaders.see_cv_label: When filling in with an x, permission is enabled for the user to view their curriculum and complete it.
xlsxHeaders.validator_label:
Hierarchical validator identifier.
It is assigned to evaluators, not collaborators.
There can only be one per evaluator.
It usually coincides with the direct head of the evaluator.
xlsxHeaders.verifier_label: Verifier, a person who confirms that the evaluated/evaluator assignment is correct during the verification stage.
xlsxHeaders.pair_category_label:
Identifier of the evaluator in the category.
The evaluation category must have been created beforehand.
Evaluators can be added in new columns by increasing the number (Ex: par_2) according to the category code
xlsxHeaders.ponderation_pair_category: Weighting the category in the calculation of the overall average

xlsxHeaders.colaborador:
The name of the 
header must be the code of the category. 

Load the result for this category 
(Ex.: 4,25)
xlsxHeaders.colaboradorUnit:
Unit (points or %). 
The category name must appear before the Underscore

xlsxHeaders.autoevaluation:
f if evaluation
t if self-assessment.
xlsxHeaders.evaluatorIdentifier:
identifier of the evaluator.
If self-assessment, leave empty.
The column header must always be 'evaluator', it has nothing to do with the category code

xlsxHeaders.color: Color of the level that will appear in the evaluation results visualization (HEX)
xlsxHeaders.convertionType:
competence: for the average of each competence (= competencegroup) and general average of goal competences:
conversion table for the objective and general average of goals.
Load it only in the conversion table by default.
Domains do not have meta conversion table.
The goal conversion table must be strictly in global %:
for the final general average
xlsxHeaders.dimensionIdentifier: domain identifier (code you created in the skills excel) + create a default conversion table, without any identifier, line 23 to 37 in the example below
xlsxHeaders.label: Label that will appear at the time of the evaluation list and visualization of the evaluated results
xlsxHeaders.maxRange:
Maximum value of the average for the corresponding category (less than or equal).
Must have 3 decimals
xlsxHeaders.minRange:
Minimum value of the average for the corresponding category (higher or equal).
Must have 3 decimals
xlsxHeaders.percentageValue:
The values entered in this column have no impact.
Ideally, leave the value of the evaluation type if the number of levels in the evaltype corresponds to the number of levels in the table.
It serves to have a reference.
But leave any value.
In the table of competencies, the ideal is that the value of the evaluation type is within the range.
xlsxHeaders.score:
The score only allows sorting.
It has to be in order and continuous (1,2,3…)
xlsxHeaders.unit:
Unit (Points or %).
The goals (goals) have to be strictly in %.

xlsxHeaders.oldEvaluator: Identifier of the evaluator to replace

xlsxHeaders.area_code: The code of the area that it is being created. It must be unique and generated by you.
xlsxHeaders.area_description: The description of the area that will appear in the processes. Optional field.
xlsxHeaders.area_parent: The code of the parent area on which the area being created will depend.
